text:
The cvs log command supports the use of tags to limit log searching. The -r flag
accepts a combination of tags. I would like to see two new attributes startTag
and endTag, this will enable the task to operate like the CvsTagDiff task.

http://cvsbook.red-bean.com/cvsbook.html#log

Thanks,
Jeremy Whiting

creator: antoine@apache.org
text:
Hello,

the tag attribute of cvschangelog, introduced in ant 1.6.1, might well solve the
problem.

cvs supports here :

    `REV1:REV2'
          Revisions REV1 to REV2 (which must be on the same branch).

so this for instance should be what you guys want :

 <cvschangelog cvsRoot=":pserver:anoncvs@cvs.apache.org:/home/cvspublic"
passfile="c:/programme/cygwin/home/myself/.cvspass"  dir="c:/dev/asf/ant.head"
tag="ANT_161:ANT_162" destfile="antpatch.xml"  >
</cvschangelog>


see :
http://www.durak.org/cvswebsites/doc/cvs_141.php#SEC141

there is also the same level of detail concerning the log options in the INFO
pages under xemacs, if you have cygwin + cvs.
